page.title: 15Coalport Village
page.content: Coalport is a small village on the north bank of the River Severn.It is strung out along the one road that runs from the Coalport bridge to the Lee Dingle around the bottom of Blists Hill.The village started as homes for the workers at the china works but now most of the houses are recent having been built in the last twenty five years.The china works is now a museum. There is only one small shop in the village ,selling sweets,drinks,and fishing goods ,and three pubs;the Shakespeare and the Brewery Inn while over the War Memorial foot bridge is the Boat Inn. The post office closed recently and there is only one postbox and one telephone box.There is one factory -the Nuway Manufacturing Company-who use old rubber tyres to make door mats.
